sen.j: 宗養（そうよう、大永6年（1526年） - 永禄6年11月18日 (旧暦)（1563年12月3日））は、戦国時代 (日本)の連歌師。
sen.e: Soyo (1526 - December 03, 1563) was a Renga (linked verse) teacher in the Warring States Period (Japan).
Soyo (1526 - December 03, 1563) was a Renga (linked verse) teacher in the Warring States Period (Japan).
Soyo (1526 - December 13, 1563) was a renga poet (linked-verse poet) in the Sengoku period (period of warring states).
sen.cmt: グレゴリオ暦に訂正しました。連歌師→renga poet (linked-verse poet) 用語集より訂正しました。戦国時代→the Sengoku period (period of warring states) 用語集より訂正しました。

sen.e: He was the son of Soboku (a famous poet), and the family name was Tani.

His go (pen name) was Mui or Hanshosai.

sen.j: 早くから父宗牧から連歌を学んだが、1545年（天文14年）20歳のとき父を失い、後連歌師としての地盤や伝書を引き継いで連歌界の第一人者となる。
sen.e: He learnt linked verse from an early age from his father Soboku, however in 1545, at the age of 20, his father died and Soyo succeeded to his writings and position as a teacher of linked verse, becoming preeminent in the world of linked verse.
sen.cmt: 伝書 writings, 地盤 position
sen.e: He learnt linked verse from an early age from his father Soboku, however in 1545, at the age of 20, his father died and Soyo succeeded to his writings and position as a teacher of linked verse, becoming preeminent in the world of linked verse.

He learnt renga from an early age from his father Soboku, however in 1545, at the age of 20, his father died and Soyo succeeded to his writings and position as a renga poet, becoming preeminent in the world of renga.
sen.cmt: 前出があるのでlinked verseをrengaに訂正しました。teacher of linked verseをrenga poetと訂正しました。

sen.j: 摂関家である近衛家や公家の三条西公条、武将の尼子晴久・三好長慶などとも交流があった。
sen.e: He had poetic exchanges with such people as members of the Konoeke clan which was part of the Sekkanke (line of regents and advisors), the court noble Sanjonishi Kineda, and the warlords Haruhisa Amago and Nagayoshi Miyoshi.

sen.cmt: ハイフン補足しました。Kineda SANJONISHI に訂正しました。AMAGO, MIYOSHI 大文字にしました。

sen.j: 父と同様に工夫は繊細であり、「石山四吟千句」「宗養句集」などがある。
sen.e: Similarly to his father, his artifices were subtle, and his works include 'Ishiyama Shigin Senku' and 'Soyo Kushu'.
